intro: Randia bracteata, commonly known as the bracteate randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that contain numerous seeds. Randia bracteata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and wetlands.
